title: Samsung Galaxy Fold Sold Out During Pre-Orders In India Within 30 Minutes, For The Second Time
text:
Samsung Galaxy Fold Sold Out During Pre-Orders In India Within 30 Minutes, For The Second Time

Samsung Galaxy Fold Sold Out During Pre-Orders In India Within 30 Minutes, For The Second Time

If you thought Galaxy Fold is too expensive and fragile to be successful in the Indian market, you'll be surprised to know that the device units were sold out in flat 30 minutes today during its pre-bookings.

Reuters

The pre-bookings commenced after a week's gap on Friday. Even last week, Samsung received pre-orders for 1600 Galaxy Folds within 30 minutes, post which, Samsung had to hit pause on the pre-order process. The next batch of pre-order is scheduled to commence on 18th of October.

Customers have paid Rs 1,64,999 during the pre-ordering process. As per Samsung, the Fold will be delivered to the customers through a premium and exclusive concierge service starting October 20.

Samsung's Galaxy Fold was unveiled in the Indian market on October 1st for a hefty price tag of Rs 1,64,999. India received the 12GB RAM/512GB storage variant of the Galaxy Fold, which is only available in Cosmos Black colour option.

Don't Miss 2.4 K SHARES 5.8 K SHARES 2.6 K SHARES

Galaxy Fold is the first phone in the Indian market to have a foldable display in a clamshell form-factor. Inside is a flexible folding screen that opens and closes like a book. The internal display when opened is a 7.3-inches Super AMOLED panel. When the phone is closed, you can use the device with the exterior 4.6-inch Super AMOLED display.

Galaxy Fold comes equipped with Qualcomm's Snapdragon 855 chipset. It is paired with 12GB of RAM and 512GB of storage space. Powering the Galaxy Fold is a massive 4380 mAh battery with support for Samsung's proprietary fast charging.

Samsung

The smartphone surrounded a series of controversies with the industrial design of the smartphone. The device started facing issues with screen breaking apart on the hands of the reviewers, Samsung put a hold on the global launch of the Galaxy Fold and worked on the issues before unveiling it globally in September.

Samsung has also included one-year accidental damage protection as well as a one-time free screen replacement for its customers in India. Galaxy Fold owners will also be eligible for Galaxy Fold Premier Service with one-on-one assistance with a Fold Concierge.
